title: A, B, C, D and E each has different height. D is shorter than B only. E is shorter than A and C. Who is the shortest of them? - Quora

response.answer_text: If D is shorter than B only,then D has to be taller than A,C and E. Which also implies that B is the tallest. Now,since E is shorter than A and C,and both A and C are below D,E has to be the shortest.
